result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Accardi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--The Court sentences 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 years &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  

--The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".

--The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

--Days credit for time already served:  3 days

--The Court STAYS this sentence, and places Mr. Accardi on Probation for 3 years
The Court orders revocation of driving privileges for six months

miscConds.notes: --to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent

--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs

--no possession of drug paraphernalia

--no operation of a motor vehicle without both a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent

--to undergo a mental health evaluation 

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy or counseling as rquired by the Agent

--to be subject to random urinalysis to detect illegal drug or alcohol use
 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: JESO
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment, education and family care, to commence on May 17th at 7:00pm

--the Court authorizes the transfer of this jail term to Dane County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the term  

---Mr. Accardi is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:40pm. 
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.
Mr. Accardi makes a statement. 

The Court sentences 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 years &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Days credit for time already served:  3 days


The Court STAYS this sentence, and places Mr. Accardi on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment, education and family care, to commence on May 17th at 7:00pm
--the Court authorizes the transfer of this jail term to Dane County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the term  
---Mr. Accardi is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo a mental health evaluation 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy or counseling as rquired by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--to be subject to random urinalysis to detect illegal drug or alcohol use
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no operation of a motor vehicle without both a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to pay costs and surcharges

The Court orders revocation of driving privileges for six months.
[The Court does not order DNA sample provision, based on ADA Beck's indication that there is already a DNA sample on file.]
Felony firearm warnings are given 
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 2:20pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Accardi
Current: 2706 Ardsley Ln, Madison, WI 53713 United States  (Effective: 05-05-2016)
Prior: 301 South 5th St., Watertown, WI 53094 United States
Distribution - DA's Office and Atty. Zarwell on 5/3/16
Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:03pm [mo]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Zarwell requests a PSI be conducted.
--questioning by the Court
--ADA Hall takes no position

The Court orders a PSI; the report is to be filed by 5/3/2016

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 2:11pm

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing on 5/12/16 at 1:30pm((allow one hour))

Case called at 9:34 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell requests continuance of trial, presents basis including various treatment options, which would result in plea/sentencing.
Court discusses entry of plea and setting out sentencing
ADA Beck indicates that the State would have no objection to setting out sentencing 6 weeks
Atty Zarwell requests a few moments to speak with Mr. Accardi
Recess: 9:38 am Reconvene: 10:12 am
Atty Zarwell submits plea questionnaire & informs the Court that there is no agreement, request sentencing at later date
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses repeater enhancer

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Court reminds Mr. Accardi that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 10:20 am 

NEXT: Schedule Sentencing Hearing 2/11/16 at 8:30 am(1 hour) - Send notices
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Continuance of FSSC and Jury Trial

Case called at 3:45pm [mo]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell indicates that discussions have been made with the State and resolution has not been reached, requests an additional stc
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess3:48pm

NEXT: 1) FSSC on 10/27/15 at 3:00pm   2)Jury Trial on 11/2 OR 11/3/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:21pm [mo]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell indicates that there is a large volume of video to view and needs additional time to do so; requests an additional status out one month
--no objection from ADA Hall 

The Court reminds Mr. Accardi that his bond and its conditions remain in effect
recess: 1:24pm

NEXT: Status Conference: 9/11/2015 at 3:00pm

Case called at 4:07pm [mo]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Court reminds Mr. Accardi that his bond and its conditions remain in effect.
recess: 4:09--reconvene: 4:10pm
Mr. Accardi updates his address effective July 1, 2015.
recess: 4:12pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 22, 2015 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on August 6, 2015 at 1:15pm

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:31am [mo]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr. Accardi waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall submits Information
Attorney Zarwell files a request to substitute Judge; the Court finds that this request has been made timely.
recess: 8:35am

Case called at 8:37am [mo]
Defendant Anthony J Accardi does not appear in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the court record, including notice of hearing sent to last known address for Mr. Accardi.
The Court finds that the Defendant had proper notice of todays hearing.
The Court issues a bench warrant, body only.
On Motion of the State, the Court finds the bond to be in default and orders it forfeit.
recess: 8:41am 

Case recalled at 8:46am; appearances remain the same
The Judicial Assistant notifies the Court that an error was made in scheduling this hearing and that the notice for todays hearing was not sent until Friday and therefore the Defendant may not have received the notice.
The Court rescinds its order for a bench warrant. 
The Court rescinds its order finding the bond in forfeit. The bond is reinstated. 
The Court informs ADA Hall that if the officer is able to attend Thursday the Court will proceed with hearing, if not then an adjourned date and time will be chosen at that time. 
recess: 8:50am

[MK] case called at 1:54pm. 
Defendant Anthony J Accardi appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (determination of PD eligibility is awaiting bond-requirement outcome).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Right to counsel given. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limits; Attorney Svehlek indicates that the Defense agrees to extend the time limits to June 5th.  

The Court requires a $500 cash bond, with conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Mark Wandersee or Taylor Ask
--not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--to take all medications as prescribed

Attorney Svehlek indicates that Mr. Accardi will now qualify for PD representation. 
recess 1:58pm. 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on June 5th at 8:30am.
